Jean-Luc Picard.Action: Jokes warmly and self-deprecatingly about changes in the crew, encouraging laughter and camaraderie.
Praises Riker and Troi sincerely, calling them family and acknowledging their positive impact on himself.
Teases Beverly Crusher about leaving, showing familiarity and friendly rapport.
Mocks the inconveniences of the situation initially in a somewhat gruff manner before softening with warmth.
Responds supportively to Beverly's playful comfort, shows restrained emotion but appreciates the support.
Makes a self-deprecating comment calling himself 'a talking head' during a toast to Deanna.
Jokingly refuses Deanna's offer to brief the counselor, showing playful interaction and care.
Invites Deanna for a dance at the ceremony.
Brings a very old bottle of wine and shares a quiet toast with Data, reflecting on history, hope, and happy endings.
Passes by celebratory dancing without direct interaction or personal engagement.
Brings a very old, treasured bottle of wine and carefully opens it, demonstrating respect for tradition and attention to detail.
Makes a thoughtful, reflective toast that connects the past, present, and future, showing insight and emotional intelligence.
Engages in a quiet, meaningful moment with Data, savoring the wine with appreciation and patience.
Expresses sadness about colleagues leaving but shows happiness for their new opportunities, acknowledges emotional complexity of human rituals, and shares personal reflections on life choices.
Encourages Data by suggesting he may receive his own command and recognizes Data’s potential and feelings.
Shares sincere and vulnerable thoughts about his personal sacrifices and life’s path, fostering trust and sincerity.
Responds warmly and gently to Data’s expression of missing him, even smiles and playfully encourages Data to make a toast.
Reflects thoughtfully on personal and professional choices, showing self-awareness and insight.
Displays confidence in predicting future opportunities for Data, encouraging growth.
Expresses complex emotions honestly and with clarity, supporting mental and emotional acuity.
Lightly teases Worf to reduce tension regarding tradition and vulnerability.
Emerges to address Worf's concerns directly, showing approachability and engagement.
Recognizes Data's deep desire to explore possible kinship with other androids and encourages the exploration, reassuring Riker they will honor Betazoid traditions.

Asks pertinent questions about the electromagnetic signature and planet, listens to expert input, evaluates potential risks near Romulan Neutral Zone, and decisively orders a course change to investigate the android signature.
Acknowledges the strategic risk but rationalizes the safety given Federation space boundary, demonstrating situational awareness and sound judgment.
Sends reassuring messages to crew, including Riker and Data, maintaining crew morale and confidence while undertaking a potentially risky mission.
Leaves bridge abruptly with a light-hearted comment about going to the gym, demonstrating confident command presence and composure under pressure.
Acknowledges Riker's concern but gently asserts his command with a lighthearted comment about Riker's wife forgiving him, showing consideration and humor.
Takes charge to personally join the risky mission despite advice, indicating willingness to protect crew and lead by example.
Acknowledges Geordi's safety concerns about the ion storm but decides to lead the landing party himself, demonstrating willingness to take personal responsibility.
Reassures Riker by referencing his wife's feelings, using interpersonal knowledge to manage the situation calmly.
Ignores Riker's protests about the potential risks and insists on the captain's prerogative, possibly underestimating danger.
Thanks Data and smiles warmly before driving off enthusiastically.
Enjoys driving recklessly despite comrades' discomfort.
Delegates tasks respectfully and with subtle humor, as shown when asking Worf to accompany Data with a light amusing remark.
Focuses on practical actions such as checking the jeep engine while others search, demonstrates composure and trust in his team.
Delegates tasks effectively by assigning Worf and Data to find the final component while he checks the jeep's engine, showing situational awareness and trust in his team.
Maintains calm and light humor when Worf questions going after the head, demonstrating confident leadership under unsettling circumstances.
Arrives just in time to rescue Data and Worf by firing the phaser cannon at attacking aliens, ensuring their safety.
Arrives at a critical moment and fires the phaser canon effectively to stop the swarm of aliens, enabling the escape of Data and Worf.
Stops aliens from overtaking the group by firing phaser canon while covering friends' escape.
Engages in light banter with the head about having a shiny head and red shirt despite danger.
Focuses on driving the jeep aggressively to protect the group and evade pursuers.
Nonchalantly rubs dirt from jeep hood and disappears without comment or interaction after landing
Jokes gently about Dr. Soong's whimsical names ('Be-nign')
Responds politely and professionally to the android head; tells Riker to keep him informed and to reassemble the B-9
Demonstrates calm and confident control by skillfully driving the jeep airborne to load into the cargo bay, then nonchalantly cleans dirt off the jeep, showing confidence and unflappability.
Makes a witty comment about Dr. Soong's whimsical naming, showing awareness and a light touch in a technical environment.
Delegates effectively by instructing Riker to keep him informed and to have the B-9 unit reassembled, showing proper command and trust in subordinates.
No direct action or interaction present in this excerpt; watches interactions indirectly (no indication of warmth or coldness).
No direct action or statement by Picard in the excerpt; observes others' interactions and the situation indirectly.
Invites Counselor Deanna Troi to sit down and listens attentively to her concerns about Data and B-9.
Responds to Deanna's concern by reminding her that Data isn't capable of disappointment, showing a somewhat detached perspective on Data's emotions.
Shares a sincere, quiet moment with Deanna, saying 'I'm going to miss you' and acknowledging mutual regard.
Calmly receives and listens to Counselor Deanna Troi's concerns about Data's emotional investment in B-9, demonstrating thoughtful consideration.
Poses an accurate and insightful question regarding emotional investment, indicating clear understanding of complex issues.
Confidently asserts that Data is not capable of disappointment, possibly showing a slight oversight or oversimplification about an individual's emotional capacity.
Promptly acknowledges an Alpha Priority communication from Starfleet Command, demonstrating alertness and responsiveness to duty.
Greets Admiral Janeway warmly with a smile, engages in light banter, and shows attentive interest in the diplomatic mission.
Engages crew decisively with unexpected orders, showing trust in their abilities.
Refers grimly to Remans as 'cannon fodder', indicating a blunt, possibly unsentimental viewpoint.
Questions and considers information thoroughly, showing respectful dialogue with officers.
Encourages ongoing investigation despite limited information, politely dismisses team after meeting.
Agrees to transfer Data's memories to B-9 to help B-9 self-actualize.
Acknowledges limited intelligence on Shinzon and orders to keep searching for information.
Agrees to memory download from Data to B-9 to potentially enhance B-9's functionality.
No explicit action or statement present related to warmth in this excerpt; Picard is absent from the scene and does not intervene or show interaction.
No direct actions or statements available in this excerpt; neither notable competence nor incompetence demonstrated.
Exhibits calm patience by waiting seventeen hours for Romulan response despite crew tension.
Advises restraint and respect for diplomatic protocols even under pressure.
Does not immediately raise shields despite recommendation, demonstrating trust and measured judgment.
Analyzes the silence from Romulus as a psychological strategy by the enemy to establish dominance and unsettle the crew.
Exercises patience and chooses not to raise shields immediately despite tension and recommendation, valuing diplomatic protocol and waiting for the right moment.
Overrides Worf's recommendation to raise shields early, demonstrating confidence in his judgment and restraint.
Refuses to raise shields immediately and demands tactical analysis before reacting.
Responds firmly and confidently to Worf's suggestion, maintaining command presence.
Identifies the opposing ship as a predator after tactical data is analyzed, showing situational awareness.
Initiates contact with the opposing force and attempts diplomacy by acknowledging the viceroy.
Quickly organizes an away team to investigate when the communication ends abruptly.
Addresses Shinzon politely and directly despite the tense situation.
Does not respond to Shinzon's silent stare or provocative behavior, maintains composure.
Does not intervene when Shinzon moves toward Deanna in a potentially threatening way.
Maintains composure and control during first encounter with Shinzon in a tense, poorly lit environment; initiates dialogue calmly and confidently despite uncertainty.
Does not immediately react or counter Shinzon’s slow advance toward Deanna Troy; shows a passive stance in potentially threatening scenario.
Firmly interrupts Shinzon's inappropriate behavior toward Deanna Troi, maintaining professionalism and protecting his crew member.
Responds curtly to Shinzon’s attempts at light conversation, prioritizing the mission and focusing on the seriousness of their visit.
Interrupts Shinzon's unsettling behavior toward Deanna with firm authority, redirects conversation to official purpose.
Maintains composure and control during a tense diplomatic encounter with an unknown and potentially hostile figure.
Expresses clear interest in the substance of Shinzon's message and keeps dialogue focused on key issues.
Expresses skepticism and caution toward Shinzon's proposal and story.
Questions Shinzon skeptically about the suspicious proposal and expresses doubt about the too-good-to-be-true peace offer.
Shows visible surprise and gasps upon seeing Shinzon's face, a reaction not shared with or understood by his crew.
Maintains composure and chooses dialogue focusing on dialogue and understanding rather than immediate aggression when confronted by Shinzon.
Invites Shinzon to talk privately, signaling openness despite uncertainty and tension.
Shows caution and verifies Shinzon's claims through medical analysis rather than blind trust.
Maintains composure and stays calm when confronted by Shinzon, despite the tension and uncanny situation.
Demands verification of Shinzon's identity before proceeding, showing prudent assessment rather than blind trust.
Immediately contacts the Enterprise and arranges a beam out after the encounter, indicating situational awareness and caution.
Shows a mixture of realization and curiosity which suggests mental engagement and openness to new, complex information.
Determines to investigate the origin of his duplicate and involves his crew, showing openness and responsibility.
Expresses a profound emotional connection to his duplicate, saying 'I not only know him, Deanna, I am him... and he is me!'
Dismisses Deanna's caution about not assuming the duplicate is like him, showing some impulsiveness or lack of tolerance for differing perspectives.
Engages in a private, calm conversation with Shinzon in a tense political environment, maintaining composure.
Smiles and gently teases Shinzon about acquiring a taste for Romulan ale.
Engages in reflective and somewhat personal conversation about physical likeness and life hardship with Shinzon.
Listens attentively to Shinzon's story without interrupting or showing judgment.
Engages calmly and confidently with Shinzon, maintaining composure and subtle wit (e.g., smiling, making light comments like 'You'll acquire a taste for it' and 'Yes. The eyes have it').
Does not interrupt or act rashly during Shinzon's revealing and emotionally charged story, showing emotional intelligence and restraint.
Acknowledges Shinzon's cause but maintains cautious distrust.
Explains his responsibility to the Federation and not allowing personal feelings to unduly influence decisions.
Engages in sincere conversation about origins and dreams with Shinzon, showing willingness to share personal history.
Shows polite courtesy by offering Shinzon to proceed first, sharing a smile.
Maintains a clear distinction between personal feelings and responsibilities as a Federation representative, refusing to let emotions unduly influence decisions.
Engages diplomatically and respectfully with Shinzon, demonstrating confidence and calmness during a tense discussion.
Exchanges a polite moment of humor and shared understanding with Shinzon, showing social skill and composure.
Smiles and makes light-hearted comments with Shinzon, showing a sense of humor and approachability.
Expresses a desire to believe Shinzon and speaks eloquently about Federation ideals of peace and unity across races, offering friendship when trust is earned.
Maintains polite and sincere dialogue with a potential adversary, emphasizing hope for peaceful relations.
Demonstrates diplomatic tact and patience by expressing willingness to build trust with Shinzon over time and emphasizing Federation ideals of peace and unity.
Responds calmly and with a sense of humor during a tense meeting, indicating emotional control and confidence.
Upon receiving serious security alert about unauthorized computer access, immediately seeks to understand details through his officers, displaying situational awareness and leadership.
Shows concern for crew safety regarding the Thalaron threat, instructs medical and security teams to respond quickly and thoroughly.
Focuses on gathering information and neutralizing threats strategically without visible panic or harsh reaction.
Questions the nature of the unauthorized access promptly, seeks detailed information about what was accessed.
Orders Worf to set up a security program to detect any unusual data stream rerouting proactively.
Shows composure and takes seriously the threat of unknown Thalaron radiation, immediately requests options to neutralize the threat.
Invites Beverly into his cabin and shares personal reflections about his younger self with sincerity.
Expresses doubt about Shinzon’s intentions and confides his worries to Beverly.
Responds to Beverly’s reassurance with modesty and a hint of insecurity, acknowledging his own struggles.
Reflects thoughtfully on his past and current threats, showing self-awareness and strategic thinking.
Immediately responds to Data's communication and moves to take advantage of new tactical information.
Expresses doubt about Shinzon's true intentions despite wanting to believe in peace, indicating cautious judgment.
Shows emotional vulnerability and internal conflict about Shinzon and himself.
Speaks gently to Counselor Deanna Troi when she describes her trauma.
Denies Deanna's request to be relieved despite her feeling violated and vulnerable, insisting on her continuing duties.
Resists the medical procedure and questions what is being done to him.
Engages Shinzon calmly, resists provocations, refuses to defend his life emotionally to an adversary.
Responds sternly and firmly to Shinzon, not showing friendliness or openness in confrontation.
Urges Shinzon to reconsider causing widespread war, appealing to his sense of reason and consequences.
Expresses belief that neither he nor Shinzon is capable of destructive acts driven by personal demons.
Responds to Shinzon's challenge with calm and a steady, probing gaze rather than anger or hostility.
Maintains calm and firm demeanor when confronted by Shinzon, uses probing and even gaze to unsettle adversary.
Tries to reason with Shinzon by appealing to his potential for self-awareness and remorse.
Acknowledges the gravity of Shinzon's threat but remains composed and confident.
Defends Counsellor Troi and asserts resilience of humans despite threat and pain.
Maintains calm under threat and does not respond with hatred or cruelty.
Whispers encouragement to Data, 'Be careful of over-playing your part, Commander!'
Compliments Data with 'Good work.' on his mission success.
Gently corrects Data's tone, 'A bit less florid, Data.'
Insists that he and Data find a way off together rather than using the ETU alone.
Encourages Data by asking for alacrity in opening the door, showing reliance and cooperation.
Displays urgency and frustration with Data's technical explanation but maintains focus on the mission.
Fires disruptor blast to seal the door mechanism behind them to protect Data and himself.
Chooses to pilot the unfamiliar Scorpion shuttle himself rather than let Data do it.
Responds to Data's concern about the wisdom of his course of action with calm resolve and assumes responsibility.
Lays down cover fire effectively while retreating with Data.
Immediately seals the shuttlebay door by firing a disruptor blast on the door mechanism after entering.
Successfully pilots an unfamiliar Scorpion-class shuttle with minimal instruction and adapts controls quickly.
Chooses to attack the shuttlebay doors from the inside by firing disruptors to blast the doors, despite security overrides and force fields.
Dismisses Data's caution and chooses a risky course of action without fully knowing the outcome.
Expresses concern for Shinzon's condition and contemplates the implications of Shinzon needing a blood donation to survive.
Accepts the reality of Shinzon as a threat but also implicitly understands the tragic nature of his engineered life.
Does not display harshness or disdain toward Shinzon despite him being a potential enemy and replacement.
Thinks strategically about threat to Earth and the Federation, shows concern for many lives.
Does not share his deep thoughts or emotional responses openly in the scene, keeps internal processing private.
Analyzes intelligence about Shinzon's weapon and correctly deduces the likely target and enemy strategy based on understanding the adversary's mindset.
Responds thoughtfully and confidently during briefing, showing clear strategic insight and leadership in assessing the threat.
Acknowledges the likely sacrifice of the Enterprise to stop the enemy weapon, communicates the seriousness of the mission clearly to his crew.
Stops to talk with an apprehensive young ensign in the corridors during battle preparation.
Expresses trust and appreciation for his crew's dedication in his personal log.
Quietly encourages Dr. Crusher to ask for help if needed, reflects thoughtfully on human nature and identity.
Watches grim preparations silently without overt display of emotion or directives.
Observes sickbay preparations calmly and recognizes the gravity of the situation while maintaining composure.
Engages in a reflective, philosophical conversation with Dr. Crusher about identity and differences between himself and Shinzon, showing intellectual depth and emotional awareness.
Offers support to Dr. Crusher and stays alert to the needs of his crew, demonstrating leadership and readiness.
Pauses when prompted by Beverly, showing openness to input and awareness of the opponent's distinctiveness.
Expresses a desire to make a human connection with his Reman double despite rejection.
Considers responsibility to try to establish connection rather than dismissing Shinzon outright.
Asks clear, purposeful questions about the Enterprise's position and fleet arrival time, showing situational awareness and command responsibility.

Reflects thoughtfully on the nature of his enemy Shinzon, considering psychological and biological factors and the possibility of human connection, demonstrating intellectual depth and strategic empathy.
Maintains focus on both tactical starship positioning and complex personal/emotional aspects of the opponent, balancing practical command with psychological insight.
Orders evasive maneuvers urgently to protect the Enterprise and crew.
Gives clear, calm, and precise battle commands under pressure.
Recognizes the cause of communication interference and orders evasive maneuvers immediately upon threat detection.
Coordinates a defensive response quickly by ordering phaser firing and photon torpedoes despite crippled warp drive and limited options.
Orders full axis rotation to port and fires all ventral phasers in response to sudden enemy assault, successfully illuminating enemy shields momentarily.
Immediately recalls Counselor Troi to the bridge upon receiving enemy hail, demonstrating situational awareness and communication.
Acknowledges Riker's suggestion about enemy cloak and agrees with it, showing openness to collaborative tactical assessment.
Refuses to surrender, appeals to shared humanity with Shinzon, speaks sincerely about the potential for goodness beneath anger and pain.
Maintains calm and controlled dialogue with opponent Shinzon despite threat; refuses to surrender and uses psychological insight to try to reach him.
Acknowledges the reality that Enterprise cannot withdraw 100 light years as demanded, showing realistic assessment of the situation.

Steps toward Shinzon with empathy, affirms Shinzon's potential for good, offers understanding by sharing his own past mistakes and a father's belief, seeks to connect and reconcile despite Shinzon's hostility.
Approaches enemy calmly and confidently, engaging in psychological dialogue to connect and attempt reconciliation rather than immediately resorting to violence.
Shows deep understanding of Shinzon's turmoil and uses personal history and empathy to influence him toward change.
Maintains composure and gently challenges Shinzon’s identity and choices, revealing strategic emotional intelligence.
Urges Shinzon to make the right moral choice despite Shinzon's resistance.
Acknowledges and thanks Commander Donatra for timely assistance with sincerity.
Urges Shinzon to make the right choice, demonstrating persistence and moral clarity under pressure.
Strides confidently to command chair upon arrival of reinforcements, immediately responding to tactical developments.
Acknowledges timely arrival of Romulan reinforcements and communicates effectively with Commander Donatra.
Feels drained and stands alone after Shinzon ends transmission; subtle hint at emotional toll but does not lose command presence.
Remains calm and assesses Donatra's situation, immediately inquiring about life support and the condition of the enemy ship, showing situational awareness and command presence despite battle chaos.
Responds calmly and promptly to a crisis, acknowledges Deanna's suggestion immediately and authorizes her to act ('Make it so').
Takes no visible direct commanding action to manage damage control after structural damage; relies on crew's initiative without additional coordination shown in excerpt.
Commands the Enterprise to attack aggressively after the Scimitar's cloak fails, demonstrates quick decision-making and leadership under pressure.
Responds to shield loss by ordering power diversion and compensatory measures immediately upon notification from Data.
Considers and proposes a concentrated phaser attack despite depleted resources, showing strategic thinking.
Thinks carefully in a high-pressure situation rather than acting impulsively.
Maintains composure and observes enemy movements directly through the hull breach.
Attempts to negotiate surrender to avoid further loss of life on enemy ship.
Shows concern for enemy crew lives despite being in conflict.
Mentions his personality flaws candidly, including over-confidence.
Uses tactical commands to execute a risky collision maneuver.
Calmly issues strategic commands to crew under pressure, coordinates precise power redistribution to engines, and prepares for a high-risk collision to disable enemy ship.
Acknowledges past over-confidence but uses it to weigh his current decisive actions, showing self-awareness and measured confidence.
Calmly steadies himself on the bridge amid chaos and takes decisive command actions to protect the ship.
Initiates the Enterprise's auto-destruct sequence, a grim but necessary action to prevent greater harm.
Maintains composure while the Enterprise is under extreme stress and prepares to initiate an auto-destruct sequence with precise voice authorization.
Shows resolute acceptance of personal risk for the greater good, indicating selflessness.
Mentions 'This isn't about me anymore' signaling concern beyond self, prioritizing others.
Maintains composure watching the Scimitar deploy a deadly weapon and assesses time until it can fire.
Recognizes the personal risk but prioritizes the mission: 'This isn't about me anymore.'
Immediately prepares for site-to-site transport and arms himself with a phaser rifle.
Insists on undertaking a one-way mission himself despite concerns from Geordi and Data, refusing to let Data take his place.
Gives clear and calm orders to maintain safety and strategic advantage, putting crew needs above his own.
Leaps onto the Scimitar and fights Shinzon and his forces to disable a weapon aimed at the Enterprise, risking his life.
Leaps up to defend himself, uses wreckage as a weapon against Shinzon.
Remains silent and contemplative after the battle, showing a distant, pained demeanor.
Leaps up and uses a metal rod as a spear to impale Shinzon, showing quick thinking and physical courage.
Maintains composure despite being pinned and threatened, demonstrating resilience and presence of mind.
Allows himself to be pinned by Shinzon, indicating a temporary loss of advantage in close combat.
Stands silently on the ruined bridge with a thousand-yard stare after rematerializing, showing battle-weariness but also steady endurance.
Puts an arm around Deanna in a moment of silence.
Thankfully acknowledges Commander Donatra's aid offer.
Gives command to prepare the shuttlebay and explains with patience.
Hands over command of the bridge to Riker respectfully.
Leads a somber ceremony with the crew, sharing mourning bands and a toast honoring Data.
Sits alone speaking quietly, expressing deep reflection and appreciation for Data's humanity.
Speaks empathetically to B-9 about humanity and change, showing understanding and patience with his lack of comprehension.
Waits quietly and watches B-9 softly humming and singing, showing emotional depth and silent support.
Encourages Riker by acknowledging the Titan's importance and expressing confidence in Riker's future as its captain.
Gently promises Riker that the Titan will become his home in time, acknowledging Riker's feelings about leaving the Enterprise.
When Riker struggles to say goodbye, Picard warmly acknowledges the honor of serving together, reflecting mutual respect and sincere appreciation.
Smiles while reminiscing fondly about a young doctor when talking with Beverly, showing friendly and warm demeanor in personal conversation.
Gives advice to Riker to ignore concerns about going on away missions, showing confidence and mentorship.
Responds to Riker’s gratitude gracefully and confidently, indicating respectful and capable leadership.
Smiles warmly at his new, fresh-faced bridge crew, expressing pleasure in teaching and nurturing a new generation.
Shows delight and good-natured humor about the new chair restraints by smiling and saying 'It’s about time.'
Comfortably adapts to new command chair and its features, showing openness and ease with new technology.
Takes initiative to engage with new crew and immediately shares mission details confidently.
